Posts.Content: Hi, I was 67 when I had breast cancer 3 years ago,so now your age, Yours sounds similar lumpectomy and full node clearance,clear margins, My oncologist told me I didn't need chemo, as would make little difference to me. rads and tamoxifen was enough, He said he thinks chemo is used to much, sometimes for no good reason, after all he said its a poison,ok it kills the cancer cells but it can do so much damage to rest of you, if you don't need it I don't give it.  My friend who was with me, and really thought I needed it, said what if was your wife or family member,He said Id say same, she doesent need chemo, apart from the cancer shes a very healthy women especially for someone of her age and chemo would probably do her more harm than good,he said as im so petite that would make it worse . 3 years on I feel fine,an d still much younger than my age.  It seems quite strange they are suggesting you for chemo, an old colleague of mine has just had very similar BC to me and you and she too has just been prescribed rads and tamoxifen.  Rads was a doddle,odd side effect with tamoxifen but now I take 2 10mg tablets a day, they have improved, Your decision though but why out yourself through it if its going to make little difference. June
Posts.Title: Decission time!!!

Posts.Content: Hi not sure if my situation will help but ill tell you. I had BC beginning of last year,my lump on my confidential report and I honestly never went into details all I wanted was it out of my body,was IDC grade 2 but when they took it out was found to be aggressive so stage 3 but that was only reason the aggressiveness of it, HER neg, UOQ 10mm one node was positive, so I said take as many as wanted,so they did, others were all clear. Surgeon said chemo would be borderline but I was determined not to have it,heard so many scare stories and sometimes people have it and it still comes back,id just lost a dear friend where it did and she had it   One of my friends was determined to make me have it, she just wouldn't give up, she came with me to see the oncologist, with another friend,  We walked in the room, he said what did they tell you, I said that I was borderline. He said "my dear you are not borderline we got it all, it was caused by your long use of HRT, all rest of nodes are clear and margains were clear, you don't need chemo, and to be honest you are such a petite slim person it would do you more harm than good, for very little extra help, you need radio therapy and tamoxifen.Im not giving something like chemo to someone like you, you just don't need it, now lump removed you are still a very healthy women go on and enjoy your life," My friend wouldn't give up she asked him what would he say if his wife or sister, he said exactly the same, she just doesent need it. They were the words id waited to hear and never expected to, but I was sure I wasn't going to have it anyway, but what he said obviously made me feel a lot happier not having it and it even reassured my friend, who I know bless her didn't want it to come back and cared about me. Go with how you feel,hopefully you will get kind of reassurance I did, but if not only you can decide,  Some people survive chemo better than others,but I know people who have been very ill on it,  Only you can make the decision Lainy c. no one else. June
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx

Posts.Content: Hi Im much older than you, and had my cancer in my 60s, couple years ago,# But a good friend of mine had the BCR gene, as have her sister and cousin, Their mums had BC.  So they all went for breast removal nearly 20 years ago. My friends sister was found to have a cancerous lump, she wasn't much older than you are now, Glad to say 20 years later, she is well and enjoying life. Lets hope its not BC but I thought if it is, knowing that someone of about your age had it, survived 20 years ago when cancer treatment  was ,not as advanced as now  and is well to this day might help to make you feel better. Hoping you hear good news.June
Posts.Title: 25 years old and possible breast cancer.

Posts.Content: Hi Ive always been skinny and 18 mths on tamoxifen I still am, ok my tummy isn t as flat as it was, and im more size 8 than 6, im barely 5 ft to but I still looks ok in clothes, cant notice really.  I did put half a stone on after my treatment but that was half a stone  I lost when had my hysterectomy in 2007.  I take 2 10 mg tablets,  one 20mg was giving me more side effects, Sometimes I take just one if ive a social event coming up, get flushes with either,  I always take mine with food and milk not water.  It hasn't increased my appitite I always had a good one and ate healthily anyway, no urges to eat sweet junk with me, my 2 squares dark choc a day that's it., Yes it has side effects tamoxifen and ive always hated taking drugs, but I guess we have no choice, just trial and error with it, and finding out best way for you.I never ate junk either and have never smoked, still got BC,   June
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and weight gain

Posts.Content: HI, I had early cancer to had lumpdectomy and node removal as one suspect but others were actually ok then radio therapy and to be honest apart from the pain of going to hospital each day, not too bad for me as I live in city on direct bus route and friends picked me up on evening ones, it was no problem at all, vaguely pink skin, no side effects, once initial measuring appointment over you are not in long, used aloe vera organic cream, and very little tenderness I have to say.  The rads team are so friendly and nice and make you feel relaxed,  Im now on tamoxifen, been on it bout 20 months now, few side effects but find 2 10 ml tablets taken different times better, To be honest I was so pleased to avoid chemo, the thought of rads and tamoxifen didn't bother me to much., Sure you will be fine, it honestly isn't painful or that traumatic.  June
Posts.Title: DCIS and radio

Posts.Content: Hi Lobdobs, Mine was my left side, I read about the deep breathing technique when I was having treatment, so I practiced the holding breath idea its seemed quite easy as I timed in when the actual rads on you can do that as its quite short and you know when they leave the room,  and im reasonably good at holding my breath in.  It seemed to work ok Have a good Christmas,   Junex
Posts.Title: DCIS and radio

Posts.Content: I had full node clearance, my first showed on ultra sound as suspect so I told them to take them when doing lumpdectomy,.  I didn't want to have to come back for further surgery, and anyway I can remember an old colleague of mine, this was a good few years ago having breast cancer,not having nodes removed and her BC came back so I always said if happens to me ill let them take most of them. I didn't have to have chemo as nodes came b ack all clear but im glad I had them taken. had radio therapy though but not on nodes. Im in my 60s but ive not had lymphedema and its over a year since mine were removed,  My BCC nurse told me as I was slim fit and healthy in other ways she didn't think would happen to me. My arm does feel slightly odd but no pain and and I have to be careful not to carry too much in my left hand  but It gives me no problems.
Posts.Title: I dont want a Total Axial Node Clearance - what are my options?

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy, My first node was suspect but I was a bit surprised when went for lumpdectomy to be told I was having clearance, I didn't have much time to think about it to be honest, but I can remember a few years ago an old colleague of mine having BC and not having nodes removed, her cancer came back and she sadly died, Id always said if it happened to me id get them to take them whatever. So I let them. The others all came back clear and had clear margains, But I don't regret having them done, yes my arm does feel a bit tingly and heavy sometimes, but it doesent stop me doing anything, I garden, carry shopping etc, ok if I do a bit too much with it it does ache so I stop, But no after effects apart from that My BC nurse told me as I was healthy in other ways and am very slightly built she didn't thing id ever get lympthodema and nearly 2 years later all well. Didn't have chemo just radio therapy and on tamoxifen. Personal choice Cathy but do what you want, I made a snap decision but as said was still thinking of my old colleague bout year older than me.guess that swayed me, and I didn't fancy any more ops, guess if other nodes affected id have had to have chemo,but again as im so slightly built the oncologist didn't want to give me that, he felt would be no benefit and possibly make me permanently unhealthy. June
Posts.Title: I dont want a Total Axial Node Clearance - what are my options?

Posts.Content: Hi, I had more than a few nodes removed  but luckily all apart from initial1  all were clear, Its nearly 2 years since I had mine and to be honest under my arm always feels a bit odd, Doesent hurt or anything sometimes feels like ive got something under it, to be honest, and there a dip where removed, But one good thing hardly ever need to,shave under there, I guess it will always feel weird so it doesent worry me, I just watch what I carry in that hand, Just feel relieved more nodes not affected and my treatment easier than many.Wound often takes a while, my rads was delayed cause mine wasn't totally healed properly.  June
Posts.Title: I dont want a Total Axial Node Clearance - what are my options?

Posts.Content: Hi, Yes I read the loneliness and survival article. im single and live alone, no kids  good friends helped me through it, one in particular. she lives very near and said if I needed her shed be there, I knew she meant it.  My oldest school friend who lives 30 miles away had ovarian same time as me breast. and shes married but her husband often seemed like in denial, so we used to phone text and message on FB a lot. We had a great and happy meal out after both our treatments finished. Im not sure what you are supposed to do if single, you cant actually go out and find a partner just cause you've got breast cancer. I felt the article could be of concern to ladies who are alone, and would worry them that because alone their survival chances might be lower.Ive never been married or lived with a partner and since my dad went into care 9 years ago, hes since died, I ve lived alone, may be im used to it, but although obviously without a partner and family you do have more lonely moments than those who do, i don't honestly think it makes your survival chances less, you have to look after yourself and socialize once recovered as much as possible.I sat said helpful friends dog through my rads, and that helped me,. If i ever felt down, a little warm body would cuddle up to ,me, and smother me with kisses, sure it helped.  cant have a dog myself, i live in a flat.   June
Posts.Title: Happiness vs Meaningfulness - an interesting article

Posts.Content: Hi Judith, You sound a bit similar to me only child, never met "the right person" anywhere, at least you had an ex, I never quite got that far, a few dates here and there.  Never knew why, im not bad looking, slim, reasonable personality, but it just never happened,. Loving parents, both reasonably social, especially my dad, never wanted any siblings even now though on own, I was happy as an only child. Have 2 cousins on my mums side, one lives in Spain, one 30 miles away, weve never fallen out, just not close. used to be when kids. I do have female friends mostly have partners, but one of them tonight was telling me she had massive row with her partner and dosent want to go to inlaws for Christmas, and hers sisters partner of 3 years just left her for someone else  so you see it isn't always perfect with a partner, everyone I know seems to have some sort of situation sometime,  I honestly wouldn't want to live with a man, not now. but someone in life would be nice, but it always seems men want to ,move in with people,  No thanks, not now. ive a few Christmas meals out etc but Christmas day ill be on own, as friends with families, Ill think of my friend with inlaws she doesent want to be with and it really wont bother me,.Its not that im friendless, just manless.  lol   June
Posts.Title: Happiness vs Meaningfulness - an interesting article

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn, Glad it wasn't just me who thought that. Its hard being on own sometimes and some find it harder than others, breast cancer is hard enough to deal with without people worrying re that, Though being partnerless I do sometimes feel it, as im an only child, parents gone, few relatives, I come from a very small family, I am fortunate in having good friends. I live in a city but I have a few friendly neighbours, friends I worked with,im  now retired  said friend whos dog I sit, love him loads bless him , and others from work, and my old school friend who had the ovarian cancer, we have known each other since in our mums womb practically, we come from same village originally, and our birthdays one day apart. She lives 30 miles from me but we still meet regularly. Also ive made a new friend on our local streetlife, she moved from London about 2 yrs ago is divorced  and she has just started a meet up dining group, we have a meal out sat night, the first evening one at our local Carluccios,Her and I have done a few things together, we both like ballet so off to that in Feb,ive also x arranged a trip for 30 friends from various shades of my life to see Mamma mia in March when it comes here It is hard being on own sometimes and yes we would all love to meet someone special, and being single does make you feel lonely sometimes  I know ive felt it,  but sadly it doesent happen to us all,\I guess women find a social circle easier than men, women on own do seem more social don't they. Surely though if you have gone through your life with no friends, you must be a very sad and unhappy person anyway, so you would find it difficult.Actually on one of the other BCC sites I was on when going through my treatment, I did come across someone like that,. she seemed very lonely but talking to her I could see why.she really made no effort to make friends ever,.  When  I said well she had worked in quite a large organisation, surely she had some friends from that,she didn't, and didn't seem to have any anywhere. She was in 60s and I found myself thinking how the hell do you get to that age with no friends,. Food for thought Carolyn.Junexx
Posts.Title: Happiness vs Meaningfulness - an interesting article

Posts.Content: Ive signed and put it on Facebook as ive a few friends who have been affected by BC.  June
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: Hi Where on earth in UK are you to get this kind of treatment, When I found my lump I went to my Dr who checked it, told me there and then she thought was BC and in less than 2 weeks I had mammogram and ultrasound,  My operation for lumpectomy was 2 weeks later, so in a month done and dusted,I had nodes taken  at same time, only one suspicious but glad they went, no chemo then rads,2 years later im fine    How on earth can they know it isn't anything just by feeling a lump.  A month or two after I found mine, a friend of mine found a lump she was quite a bit younger than me but she got a mammogram and ultra sound, someone else I knew same ok they didn't have BC but they were tested properly.  Insist on a scan and mammogram, its disgusting you didn't get one before. don't take no for an answer, You are entitled to the full tests, get them.  Its shocking they didn't give them to you, Keep us posted. June
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: HI, Hopefully it wont be anything but with family history im appalled they didn't test you further,  A close friend of mine has the gene, discovered by tests when her mum had BC and several family members had it to,  Her sister had tests to and at 28 a cancerous lump was discovered,  and had she  double mastectomy  But 20 years later she is well,  My friend and cousin had mastectomy on both breasts, as a precaution.   Yours hopefully wont be but don't take any Nos for answers, June ,
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: maxinem2 Hi All Haven't posted for a while as I seem to be getting back into the daily grind. All treatments complete and only check up appointments left to do (apart from permanent reconstruction but next breast clinic appt is December so not even thinking about that yet). My question is about tamoxifen and I apologise in advance as I know it's been talked to death. I've looked through historical posts and can't quite find an answer relevant to me. I've been taking tamoxifen for forty days. When I started I was still experiencing side effects from chemo so it has taken a while to narrow down what causes what. I now feel like I understand what the tamoxifen is doing. I was given wockhardt brand which, from memory, is a brand that some found the easiest to deal with.  I am suffering from painful hands and feet, escalating to wrists and ankles, sometimes reaching as far as the elbow and knee and occasionally one hip! The worst part for me is my thumb base, worse in my dominant hand, causing me to need help (or suffering pain if there's nobody around) when I try to do things like opening pop bottles, opening bags of crisps or similar, closing press studs, pulling up trousers, squeezing the toothpaste tube. I'm sure there's a hundred more things but you get the gist. I love to cross stitch and I'm afraid the pain is cramping my style in that area too. So, on to my question, has anyone been in the same boat, with this brand? (Or is it really the best one) And if so, was there anything that would ease the pain, or did you change brand successfully? I'm reluctant to change brand as one of my initial worries was that the tamoxifen would turn me into superbitch, but it has mellowed my mood massively and I don't get the irrational mood swings I was getting (my whole life) previously. Does anyone know if changing brand would have any effect in that area? Many thanks in advance as always. maxinem2 Hi All Haven't posted for a while as I seem to be getting back into the daily grind. Posts.Title: Tamoxifen (for probably the millionth time)

Posts.Content: Hi, I ve been on tamoxifen for 2 years,and take 2 10 mg tablets at different times of day,.  Im way past menopause and high risk of osteoporoisis. hence the tamoxifen rather than other drugs.   Apart from hot flushes and night sweats I don't seem to get too many side effects, feel a bit stiff in mornngs but after few exercises, im ok, The flushes and sweats are not too bad and don't last long. Im much older than you and honestly I feel a lot younger than my age, I wasn't mad on taking tamoxifen as ive always been anti drugs, well I took HRT for years, hence the breast cancer, my oncologist said, but I never really thought of that as a drug. Taking one 20 mg did give me more side effects but with the 2 10 mg it doesent see too bad,  From what ive read on here tamoxifen does maybe seem better than the others , they seem to have worse side effects, so maybe give it a go,I take the Wockhardt  brand. June
Posts.Title: Anastrozole/Letrozole & Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi Where on earth in UK are you to get this kind of treatment, When I found my lump I went to my Dr who checked it, told me there and then she thought was BC and in less than 2 weeks I had mammogram and ultrasound,  My operation for lumpectomy was 2 weeks later, so in a month done and dusted,I had nodes taken  at same time, only one suspicious but glad they went, no chemo then rads,2 years later im fine    How on earth can they know it isn't anything just by feeling a lump.  A month or two after I found mine, a friend of mine found a lump she was quite a bit younger than me but she got a mammogram and ultra sound, someone else I knew same ok they didn't have BC but they were tested properly.  Insist on a scan and mammogram, its disgusting you didn't get one before. don't take no for an answer, You are entitled to the full tests, get them.  Its shocking they didn't give them to you, Keep us posted. June
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: I signed it when on facebook,  Yes it is disgusting that these drugs are being denied to people who need them to stay alive.Even before I had cancer I always believed drugs for it were so important, ive seen so many peoples lives taken from them too soon. One of my close friends has the gene, her mum and aunt sadly died of Breast cancer,  Her, her cousin and sister all have gene and all had breasts removed at a young age.in fact they found her sister had a cancerous lump when did the tests,  In fact it was her sister who put on FB  about the this particular drug .That was 20 years ago and shes fine.  I was out with my friend at the weekend and she was talking about her mum, she was 25 when she died of it and she shes 43 now, and she said my mum wasn't much older than me when she was first diagnosed, 48, she died at 54 who knows if drugs like this around then, she could still be here, shed only be about my age, my friend has a 12 year old daughter she never saw.  Those kind of stories as well as my own BC make me so angry when these drugs are not allowed to be used,when so much mon ey is wasted on pointless useless things,   June
Posts.Title: petition the government to continue Kadcyla for breast cancer patients...

Posts.Content: HI, Hopefully it wont be anything but with family history im appalled they didn't test you further,  A close friend of mine has the gene, discovered by tests when her mum had BC and several family members had it to,  Her sister had tests to and at 28 a cancerous lump was discovered,  and had she  double mastectomy  But 20 years later she is well,  My friend and cousin had mastectomy on both breasts, as a precaution.   Yours hopefully wont be but don't take any Nos for answers, June ,
Posts.Title: Should I get a second opinion??

Posts.Content: I took HRT for over 20 years, I had an early menopause like my Mum who developed osteoporosis so badly she basically crumbled away, one of worst cases ever seen we were told. the last 10 years of her life she died at 82 were horrendous.  She was 4 inches taller than ,me, and when she died I towered over her, I had no desire to get this awful disease, so I took HRT,and yes I got breast cancer, caused my oncologist told me by HRT,.But I haven't got osteoporosis so im not sorry I took it, I had lumpdectomy and radio therapy and over a year on im ok, But I cant help wondering if I over dosed on HRT I took it for so long, im 4 ft 11in and weigh 7 stone so surely I shouldn't have the same dose as someone who is 5ft 6in and weighs 11 stone.  Im on tamoxifen and side effects of that not great im going to my Dr to see if can change it to maybe a 10 mg dose. I cant help wondering if drugs shouldn't be tailored more to peoples build etc. after all we give kids under 12 lower doses,most kids of 12 are taller than me. Surely one size doesent fit all.
Posts.Title: HRT study results

Posts.Content: Hi Ruthie, I had lumpdectomy, grade 2, but it was aggressive which made it stage 3 just for that reason,. 1 node was suspect,rest fine but id told them to take them anyway, When I saw surgeon he said I was borderline for chemo,gave me load of statistics which went over my head, was week or so before I saw oncologists, at my hospital we see one for drug treatments and one for physical one. Saw one for drug treatment he said !we got all your cancer you know" tamoxifen for 10 yrs,  Then saw the other oncologist who told me very emphatically I did NOT need chemo, I was a healthy women but im very slightly built and it could affect me very badly,in fact he said much more than cancer had.  he said as my cancer in his eyes had been caused by my long term use of HRT, and nothing else, he felt having chemo would be pointless, My friend who was with me and was convinced that everyone needs chemo, we had been arguing about it as id said I wasn't having it anyway,pressed him as to was he sure, he said very, she doesent need it and im not giving it to her when she dosent,  Its often given when unnecessary and it is for her, Rads and tamoxifen will be fine. I have to stress mine was a smallish lump, though aggressive found very early. Yes many do have chemo and are ok, but many are not my hairdressers mum in law who had BC same time as me, is still suffering the after effects, heart problems, and had to have a bowel operation. I don't think her health was good as mine, I believe she smoked but 2 years on she hasn't recovered, whereas I have no after effects. They are powerful drugs, and im having to come to terms with taking tamoxifen for 10 years, and ive had one of two problems with it, but nothing serious and ok now, so I can see no point in having something like chemo if it will hardly make any difference,  Your choice Ruthie, make it yourself,dont let anyone tell you what to do, only you and you alone can decide.  June
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: You poor dear, can sympathise, my cancer was more straight forward than yours lumpdectomy all my nodes went but only first one was suspect, others clear, clear margins I was stage 2 to 3 only because mine was aggressive but I found it very early.  However the first consultant I saw was awful, he wasn't European even, I couldn't understand him, he made me feel like I would have to have chemo whatever, which I didn't have to.  he honestly made me feel like I was going to die.Luckily I had two good friends with me, as I was too shell shocked to hear much,.  Then when on my way home my phone rang , one of my friends was driving me home, it was the nurse saying he wanted to postpone operation!. I went completely to pieces, my friend took over csll and she was great she said I couldn't deal with any delay and I needed to have operation sooner rather than later. I got a new surgeon, a Hungarian, nice friendly man, good English,did great job and operation a week earlier. As said no chemo needed, the oncologist I saw, another really nice man said chemo for me wasn't necessary, as im tiny would do me more harm than good and am on tamoxifen for 10 years, Ask  for another surgeon, you deserve better treatment than this,  I haven't got any nodes left under my left arm, I just wanted them all gone, anyway, its a rather odd numb feeling, but I can live with that, There is no reason why you cant have all your nodes taken,it certainly hasn't done me any harm. Demand don't ask for another surgeon. June
Posts.Title: Confused after unhelpful consultant appointment

Posts.Content: Hi To be honest even my Dr told me she thought my lump was cancer when she felt it, obviously she knew about my long term use of |HRT in fact when I joined her practice she tried to get me to come off it, so possibly that influenced her to,. Friends kept saying possibly not but I knew in my hear of hearts it was.  I can remember having the scan, they had allowed one of my friends in with me.shes been on cancer route, her family has the gene, her mum and aunt died many years ago, her sister had it, but is ok 20 yrs later my friend and her cousin have both had full mascectomys to prevent it. so it helped having her there .  The Dr doing scan told me to it was definitely cancer, and suspect lymth node guess they know what they see, I was glad in a way as I never had false hopes, and as it was I didn't need mascectomy, just lumpdectomy, no chemo just rads and on tamoxifen. Im 2 years on now,.and feeling fine. June
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: Hi, I was 67 when I had my BC two years ago so  am same as you now, Like you I have little family, no kids grandkds etc, but good friends. However after my lumpectomy one node only affected, others clear, I did have rads, chemo wasn't necessary was told, but I have to say that I wasn't going to have,  However rads no problem at all, I breezed through them, now on tamoxifen, as due to my high osteoporosis risk, my mum had it very badly and im very small boned, that was only drug I could take without taking bisophosonates, Could you not take tamoxifen instead,save you taking an extra drug, Like you I hate taking drugs always have, my dad survived very happily till over 90 not taking any, but once they started giving them to him, he was never same, till he died at 98,.so that's always put me off too,  I take 2 10 mg tamoxifen, that seems manageable better than one 20 mg one. But as I never really felt ill, and I come from a long living family and feel much younger than my age, I decided yes I would have the treatments and 2 clear mammograms later, don't regret it,  But its your choice, only you can decide what you want.  June .
Posts.Title: Declining further treatment after breast surgery

Posts.Content: Hi,I had breast cancer 2 years ago and my first node was suspect on biopsy. I told them I wanted other nodes removed to,  Reason being, an old colleague of mine who had breast cancer a few years ago, didn't have her nodes taken,and her cancer came back. I always said if it happened to me I would have them removed , I was Stage 3 but only because my cancer was aggressive but caught early,  so I didn't need chemo, just lumpectomy,   rads and on tamoxifen. The other nodes were clear but I don't regret having them taken,better to be safe than sorry, OK ive bit of a dent under my arm and it doesent feel quite the same as other underarm, but no other problems with it. Id say if they want to take them, let them, cancer is a sneaky beast, it can lurk, I d say you will feel happier once gone. I did.    June
Posts.Title: Choosing not to have axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi, I read on here sometimes how great some of them are, but seems we were unlucky. After the first surgeon I didn't like, all other doctors and nurses were great, but not the BCC ones,  Its hard to do it alone if you have no partner or. much family. My oldest friend who lives 30 miles from me had ovarian at same time as I had BC and bless her she worried about me being on own as shes married and has family, she was upset couldn't help me more bless her.  But my friends here were very good,the friend who dealt with nurse particularly so, she told me if I ever needed her, she only lives bout 10 min drive away, whenever or whatever time to call her and shed be round. I sit her dog for her, so im round hers a lot anyway,   as im retired  that helped to, he bless him was a great comfort to me to, used to cuddle up to me if he sensed I was down, Hope you get good news, keep us posted, you will find the helplines on here and the BCC one very helpful too,it just seems to be sometimes at local level it falls down.  June
Posts.Title: So now my BCN is lying to my face...............

Posts.Content: Hi Louise, Im happy to tell you all of my experience. No problem.mine was grade 2 initially, ER pos HER2 neg omne node was positive.13 mm  then scaled up to 3 only because was fast growing, but as I found it early, they removed the lump,and margains were clear and other nodes fine,  I told them to take more as id didn't want another operation and someone I worked with a few years ago, didn't have her nodes removed, and her cancer came back, Ok mine were fine, but losing them hasn't caused me any problems,  When I originally saw the surgeon he said I was borderline for chemo but didn't seem to think would make that ,much difference anyway so I had decided I didn't want it.  When I saw the oncologist, his first words were "you dont need chemo" the best words id heard since diagnosed, he said you were on HRT far too long,thats what caused your BC nothing else, you are a very healthy women in every other way.Chemo would hardly make any difference to your prognosis which is good anyway and im not giving it to someone as healthy as you, you are tiny, im 4 11 and weight 7 stone, it could do you more harm than good in fact it could debilitate you for life" My friend who was with me and bless as im single had been a tower of strength to me, said are you sure, what if was your wife or sister, he said id say the same, she doesent need chemo, Rads and tamoxifen is fine , HRT shouldn't be prescribed, my friend who is on menopause said I was thinking of starting it, he dont think about it ever.   This was beginning of last year and im feeling fine now.  Obviously mine also was caused by high oestrogen too, like yours, Problems with tamoxifen was I started getting a lot of bloating and some joint pain after being on it a year, though Im over 60 tamoxifen was prescribed because of my osteoporosis risk, I dont want to take other drugs for that. So Dr changed me to 10mg tablets, I take 2 at different times of day, seems better, this way, I dont get joint pain now and bit b loating but nowhere near as bad. Ive always hated taking drugs, I resisted the one for osteoporosis as it also gave me gastric problems and it was same one my mum took years ago which frankly did her no good at all. But I know ive got  to take tamoxifen and it does help bones so im "killing 2 birds with one stone" I guess. I had my first mammogram in March and now feel fine. Its weird its like it happened to someone else now I dont dwell on it, and try and put it at back of my mind, maybe that is easier if you dont have the trauma of chemo, I dont know. Keep me posted how you get on and anything else you want to know ill be pleased to inform you if I can.I know when I was diagnosed, 2 people I know who had had BC over 20 years ago and both fine now, I had a chat with and they advised me, it always helps to talk to someone who has been through it. Junex
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: Hi, When I had BC last year, I found the breast cancer nurses useless to be honest,  I met the one who was supposed to be mine when I first went for results of scan, but I disliked the surgeon she worked for intently, and when I got home from hospital had a phone call from her to say "Mr   ......wants to change your operation date to a date 9 days later" I just burst into tears, luckily my friend had brought me home and she took over call, and was very firm in saying I lived alone was in state and did not need operation date changed.and they needed to sort it. bless her she was great, I then got a much more people friendly surgeon who did a great lumpdectomy but I only saw his nurse once when I went back for my after operation appointment, I don't think I even knew her name. Thank god for my friends, as I don't have a partner or much family cause the BCCs were a waste of time. and honestly gave me no support at all, I didn't have to have chemo and the radio therapy team were great, but BCCs I just wasn't impressed. I got a lot more help from the nurses on the helpline here,  June
Posts.Title: So now my BCN is lying to my face...............

Posts.Content: HI ,] I took HRT for over 20 years to stop osteoporosis the illness than destroyed my mum.as I had early menopause like her and even tinier bones than she did, I knew the risk with BC but I didn't want to end up like her, it wasn't nice,. So I got BC no chemo just rads and tamoxifen, Took it for a year, was ok then I suddenly started getting lots of bloating, I have the problem because of my high osteoporosis risk though im past the menopause I cant cant take any other hormonal drugs because they weaken bones, So Dr changed me to 2 10 mg tablets  This seems better,  still get a bit of bloating , not great as im only a size 8 and tiny  but liveable with, nowhere near as bad though as the 20 mg one.  Hate taking pills, before BC apart from HRT was loathe to take an asprin, but needs must so persevere  June..
Posts.Title: Hormone Therapies, Mood and Memory.....

Posts.Content: Hi, This interested me as I have been having Dexa scans for years due to my high risk of osteoporosis, because my mum had it extremely badly, also ive tiny bones anyway,  Im on tamoxifen even though past the menopause as they didn't advise any of the other drugs due to bone thinning, MY HRT they think cause the BC in first place.  So surely I will still be entitled to a Dexa scan, I know tamoxifen can help strengthen bones, that's what im hoping, as the pills recommended for osteoporosis have much worse side effects than that, so it seemed less of two evils and sort of killing 2 birds with one stone, so to speak.My neighbour who has had back pain for years has now been diagnosed with Osteoporosis and they say actually ha a compound back fracture, She is refusing to take any of the drugs cause of side effects mentioned as she already suffers from IBS. I feel now even if HRT gave me BC hopefully it might have stopped me getting the full blown osteoporosis and tamoxifen will hopefully carry on the good work, June
Posts.Title: Dexa scan

Posts.Content: Hi  Jump 123, had my rads last year April to June, My hospital gave me no indication there would be anything like yours did, no wonder you were scared. I had 10 sessions and to be honest it was a piece of cake. You are in there such a short time, its over before you know it,  I had no blistering, reddened skin, pain or anything similar,took no painkillers and carried on life as normal, and id had lots of nodes removed too  thought they were clear .  My skin possibly went slightly pink and im fair skinned but have always creamed my skin regularly a lot,whether that helped I don't know.  I used   Aloe vera gel organic all way through treatment and still do now,In fact I never put any other lotion on my scar and around the breast but that, Hospitals really should not scare people in this way,its ridiculous, Cancer is hard enough to deal with without that.  Hope all goes well June
Posts.Title: Rads - Panic?

Posts.Content: Hi No I knew as soon as I found lump it was cancer, id been on HRT for years , knew the risk  and my doctor was very honest with me so did she. Once id had lumpectomy, and agree o hated the damm drain more than anything, Im barely 5 ft and I felt annoyed they cant make drain for shorties like me,.lol.I was fine. I almost fell out with friends cause they all thought should have chemo and I wasn't going to, to be honest daft as it sounds, losing my hair worried me more than the cancer, My most joyus moment was the oncologist telling me I didn't need chemo, just rads and that gave me no problems at all, breezed through it, very slight pinkness, no real problems at all,. On tamoxifen yes have side effects and flushes can be a pain but to be honest apart from mammogram time I don't often think about BC. Just pop on here to encourage others, I was advised this was best way to go by 2 people who had BC many years ago, both still going strong and ive followed their advice. June
Posts.Title: Abnormal lack of feelings?

Posts.Content: Hi Judith, I had lumpectomy and rads over 2 years ago and taking tamoxifen and my gums have become very sensitive to,  I never hardly used to need scaling and always had perfect gums till then, My dentist whom ive known for years started lecturing me do I do this and that, yes I floss, clean regularly, use Cordysyl daily, and normal Cordysl before bed, and also take C0Q10 capsules, and it is better than was, but my gums still bleed if I slightly over clean my teeth, something that never used to happen My dad had his teeth till he died at 98, and ive very similar teeth so never worried about them.  But they do all seem intact so ive put it down to the tamoxifen,  Couldn't believe my dentist seemed to have no idea this could be a problem.June
Posts.Title: Teeth after treatments

Posts.Content: Hi, Not going to tell you not to worry you will,  Im much older than you, though feel much younger, I knew at my age and so did my doctor it was BC id been on HRT for years to, another reason I knew the risks of that. But I found it early 2 years later, after lumpdecomy and rads im here and well,   Your risk of having BC is much lower,  But if it is, my friends sister had it at 28, her family had the BR gene and it was discovered when they had the gene test, they both had the gene, but she actually had cancer, but 20 years later shes ok and enjoying life.  And treatments have improved a ,lot in that time.    Keep us posted.   June
Posts.Title: Waiting on scan for lump in left breast, worried sick.

Posts.Content: I agree.i was lucky enough not to have chemo so I didn't lose my hair but when I was first diagnosed, the thought of losing my hair was the thing that upset me most.I was even accused of being so vain by friends,  I spose because I was in my 60s and single I m not supposed to care how I look, well I do.I grew my hair when I was just over 60, id had short hait for years,but this "older women shouldn't have long hair" wound me up so much,i decided to grow it,and as my brunette locks had bits of grey, I dyed it red,  I love it, I vowed never to cut it short again just have regular trims so thought of losing it uspet me so much, Im sure all these people are well meaning  with this "brave the shave" but I hate it,To be honest im not keen on the other adverts for cancer, I hated the last years one where the bloke sits in an icy wasteland and the caption "cancer is such a lonely thing" comes up.  Totally depressing, Lets have a few more positive adverts and campaigns, Cancer is bad enough we dont need all this downbeat stuff,
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: I cant believe thy are still doing it, when so many of us cancer survivor are against it.  I was fortunate I didn't need chemo, in end, but I know the thought of having to lose my hair made me more unhappy than the cancer, if that doesent sound ridiculous . Ive always had short hair but when I retired I felt   quite rebellious you know the older women shouldn't have long hair  thing I grew mine, and dyed it mahogany as my natural brunette was greying and dark hair nor flattering on older skin. t took me 2 years so to have to lose it again would have devastated me. I really think they should listen to those who have had cancer, surely they are a group for us, I never liked that horrible wilderness type advert either, that happened the year I had mine. it used to make me feel very uncomfortable, it was so bleak and scary, perhaps they should ask us our ideas and let us design a campaign. June
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi, Thanks for that, The reason I took HRT for so long was the fact that my mum had early menopause too and she got osteoporosis very badly she was taller than me,im the family miget. lol but by time she died I towered over her,  It totally crippled her and my mum was a very smartly dressed lady. she hated seeing  herself with this horrible hump, she basically just gave up, She had to go into care my dad couldn't cope with it,he bless him was 5 years older than her and lived till 98. She didn't look like my mum any more I hated seeing her that way, and she would have hated it too, she was too bent to see herself in mirrors, A girl I knew was one of carers in home and she only recognised my mum by my picture by her bedside. That's how much she had changed, So Carolyn you can see why I felt as I did when I got BC, i didn't ever regret taking HRT for so long,i never wanted to end up looking like my mum, I do care about how I look and I always will. Luckily I have inherited my dads teeth he had them till he died, no chipslol. I don't think people realise how women are tied up with their hair, losing it is crap, i give thanks every day i didn't when i brush it.i overplucked my eyebrows when young as we all did in 60s, i have to pencil them in, but ive still quite good eyelashes., A strange side effect of node removal seems to be underarm hair doesent seem to grow, Now that i can live with.  June.
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi I do agree, I was fortunate enough not to need chemo but I know until I had my operation and once results back was told didn't need it, thought of losing my hair was one of worse things I could imagine, People kept saying its only hair it will grow, but no one understood, my friends thought I was being ridiculous, but the thought of it used to make me feel sick.  I could have hugged my oncologist when he told me I didn't need it. So how the hell can anyone imagine that braving the shave through choice is the same,  It isn't, when people popped up on FB with it I just felt angry with them for thinking they knew what it was like dreading it happening to you. Noone knows unless you have that hanging over you, for me it was honestly worse than operation.  June
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn I so agree with you, the fear of cancer is awful worse than having it,  I to be honest and this might sound daft am glad Ive had it because its taken the fear of getting it away, If we constantly go on about battles, etc, people continue to see Cancer in such a fearful way worse than any other illness, And it isn't its an illness like heart disease, diabetes etc. My mum suffered with osteoporosis, she had it so badly though she was 4 inches taller than me, I towered over her when she died, the drugs she took were useless and she became so deformed it was pitiful to see her,  I took HRT for years as also had early menopause like her, which my oncologist said caused my breast cancer, But do you know ive no regrets as my cancer was found early, 1 suspicious node, clear margains, no chemo, and rads now on tamoxifen. Im feeling fine at the age my mum was starting to feel the effects of osteoporosis, id rather have had cancer than what she had.  Until we start dealing with cancer like any other illness, peoples fear of it it will never change and Macmillans campaigns don't help this. Before I knew I didn't need chemo the fear of losing my hair was worse to me than having the cancer,. im a tough old bird, I knew id get over it, but losing my hair filled me with horror, I was set to refuse chemo,as initially I was borderline, in spite of my friends entreating me to have it. Ive always had short hair but starting growing it at 60 it took me two years, I always hated the "older women shouldn't have long hair", im dammed if I wanted to lose it.  I look a lot like my dad, and he was bald, he nearly drowned when young and it caused him to lose his hair, shock they said,  I adored my dad, but I didn't want to look that much like him.lol. Junex
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Hi  As a cancer survivor of neary 4 years i agree with these comments. Yes having cancer isnt great and yes people die of it.But many people recover and go on to live long and healthy lives.When i had breast cancer thankfully caught early, one of my oldest friends had ovarian cancer Stage 4 nearly 4 years later shes fine, ok on medication,as i am,but enjoying life.And tonight on Standing up to cancer Gary Linekars son George had luekimia as a baby,his parents were told wouldnt last night twice,now 26 and fully recovered. We need more of these kinds of stories to show cancer is an illness like any other,many recover from it and take away the mystique of it, which often puts fear into peoples heads and they ignore symptoms and we all know early detectiom helps survival chances Like you Alison its that sad music that gets to me,and yes you are right people with cancer are living lives.My old friend and i rarely mention ours and to be honest thankfully nor do many of my friends mine.And thats fine,cancer doesent define us. June
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: So agree,it keeps popping up on my facebook page,and everytime i comment that many of us survivors dont want people to shave their heads.Like you i didnt need chemo but it still annoys and upsets me.One woman told me the people who do it are brave.! I told her the brave people were those who have had cancer,i was lucky many had it hard.I also told her one my oldest friends had ovarian cancer when i had breast,5 hour operation,she now has to have 3 monthly check ups as her cancer is still there,could come back, and another friend,her sister and her cousin all watched their mums die of breast cancer,then discovered all had BCR gene,so all decided to have full masectomy on both breasts,her sister already had it,they discoverd the lump.Now they have to live with fact that their teenage daughters will have to be tested and my friend who is youngest of the 3 still has to have her ovaries removed before shes 50. They are the brave ones and all the people on here going through chemo now,maybe losing eyebrows,eyelashes,even finger nails and toenails.Not silly people shaving their heads.   June
Posts.Title: Does anyone else dislike the Macmillan Brave the Shave campaign?

Posts.Content: Was anyone else as angry as I to read in paper today about increasing cancer rates, indicating it could be peoples lifestyle as to why they get cancer,.  We had the usual smoking, obesity etc.  Well as a person who has NEVER smoked, never been obese, never even slightly overweight , weigh same as when I was 30, walks for England, especially as don't drive, and eat very healthily, in fact when I was diagnosed one of my closest friends said "god you've never even eaten a burger" I resent this kind of thing. From what ive read of many of you on here, you are same as me, always done the right thing and still got breast cancer.  My only risk was my long term use of HRT because of my early menopause,and my high risk of osteoporosis  due to my slight build and my mum having it very badly. This of course was prescribed to me by a doctor,.My mum had it so badly, I didn't want to end up like her, and as my other risks were so small, I took HRT for a long time,.  Now I wonder did I take too much,did I as a small slight women need the dose I took. I don't need this kind of rubbish that cancer is a lifestyle thing, nor do any of us  it isn t, its random it can happen to anyone, fit or not fit,.  When I went to see my oncologist for the first time, after my operation and he told me I wouldn't need chemo, I noticed on the computer screen it said "very healthy women" and he said for my age I was in excellent shape. Yet I got cancer, so lets stop giving people the idea they can prevent cancer,they cant, it can happen however fit you are. Rant over. June
Posts.Title: Newspaper article re cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Annagran,. Yes I do agree, ok I took HRT which seemed to be my only risk factor that I could see,and I probably took it to long. but  I watched my mum disintegrate with it, She was 4 inches taller than me, and by the time she died I towered over her. Take HRT the doctors said, if you don't want to end up like her. Well I haven't got that but I got cancer. I now use pareben free deodorant but I do still drink wine,i enjoy a glass with my evening meal, but I always buy low alcohol wines now, and junk food has never passed my lips.  Some said to me "o well you can eat what you want now" lol, no thank you I hate junk food anyway, im hardly likely to start living on Macdonalds. My oldest friend who had ovarian cancer same time as I had breast ran into someone we were both at school with, after she had recovered from it,  This women who is very obese said to her "O you with all your gym visits and weighing same as when young ,  etc. " and you got cancer, look at me im fine.  I would have said "you don't know whats going on inside"  or worse lol but my friend who is a kindly soul just gritted her teeth. A another  friend of mine whose mum and gran both had BC is now on a mad exercise kick, runs every morning, circuit training, god knows what else. she was slim and petite anyway. and didn't smoke,.  This all started after her mum got it, I hope she doesent think it will definitely stop her getting it, cause obviously theres a family connection. There are no guarantees sadly and id hate that  these kind of articles might make people think there are. Hope we both stay well, have my second year mammogram in couple weeks, always a bit worrying but I try not to think about it too much. As I said to my friend, the fact we were pretty fit helped us to recover quicker and should stand us in good stead. Junex
Posts.Title: Newspaper article re cancer

Posts.Content: Hi I didn't have to have chemo so didn't lose my eyebrows but ever since shaving them off as were very dark in my youth and days of thin brows, ive hardly had any anyway. never could find a pencil that really looked natural as they never grew back properly.   I now use a fantastic eyebrow pencil well more of a thin crayon, looks extremely natural best one ive ever used, I I think its a Sleek one, cant be sure  as the markings have worn off it now  but Superdrug seem to have many similar ranges with these new type eyebrow  crayons and they seem so much better than the old fashioned eyebrow pencils and look so realistic.  Im a brunette who now dyes her hair mahogany and I use the brunette one and dark brunette if go out in evening,. Not expensive and do  great job. Many seem to dye their hair after chemo, my hairdresser whos mum had BC and had chemo says vegetable dyes are fine.  June
Posts.Title: Eyebrow Tinting!

Posts.Content: HI, I can remember being told "you know we got it all don't you", which was encouraging,but I had rads to be on safe side was told, and ican remember going for my rads prep and it was put off for a week or so  cause my wound hadn't totally healed, I had visited my local surgery to have dressing removed and it checked but no surgeon had checked it,So id say that's all he wants to do make sure ready for rads.  June
Posts.Title: Now I'm really worried

Posts.Content: HI, You sound like me nearly two years ago, I was Grade 2, didn't need chemo, just rads and tamoxifen,  I agree when the oncologist told me I didn't need chemo,i could have hugged him.My friend who was with me said are you sure she doesent, He said no she doesent, weve got it all, we know her HRT caused it,.go and enjoy your life my dear. Rads no problem, my skin went vaguely pink been on tamoxifen for bout 20 mths I spose, few side effects, but more manageable with 2 10 mg tablets taken at different times. under arm slightly odd cause of node removal, they were ok but first was suspect so I told them to take all but when my arm down don't notice.  You do feel so relieved I know, and feel as you say kind of reborn.    June
Posts.Title: I have my results

Posts.Content: Hi ive been on tamoxifen for 2 years and had my cataracts done last year but I don't think I was on it long enough to affect my eyesight, and anyway ive worn glasses for years, and not had good eyesight,.   I have to say after my operation I now only need off the shelf reading glasses, my eyesight is good and I am very happy with the result,  I am in ;late 60s so guess would expect them now, although my dad was in 90s before his were done. I now take 2  10 mg tablets of tamoxifen  as I did have digestion problems with 20 but to be honest I still get them somewhat and am questioning if I as a very peite slim women need a 20mg dose,.and it is it too much for me.  I honestly find when I take one 10mg tablet it suits me better,  I often do this if I am going out for a meal or similar and I honestly find it better,.  I think this one size fits all with drugs is doubtful  After all with everyday drugs its often said children under 12 don't need the full dose,  My friends 12 year old daughter is taller than me.! It does make you wonder if the side effects are considered enough and why more research doesent seem to be done into how different drugs and measures of drugs affect different people. T  hese drugs companies make a fortune out of cancer treatments, surely the side effects should be considered much more.June
Posts.Title: Letrazole and cataracts

Posts.Content: Hi, Had a few problems with tamoxifen myself so know . what you mean,  But in my case I didn't have chemo,just rads and due to my mums osteoporosis and having tiny bones im high risk of osteoporosis anyway I feel I have to persevere,  I switched to taking 2 10 mg tablets, at different times of the day with milk, not water and with food. Does seem to have helped, I had bloating to and that is better, still get it occasionally but not as much. Sometimes if say Im going out in evening, I skip one pill and only take one in evening when I get home. Dr said this was ok. Did read the other day, did anyone else?that they gave women who are high risk of getting BC tamoxifen and others a placebo, and they all had same side effects,  I do find that hard to believe, after all they might be high risk but they haven't actually had BC have they,  My body must have been loaded with oestrogen as I took HRT for years due to early menopause like my mum, guess it still wants it, if only but I was told in no uncertain terms by my oncologist that oestrogen caused my BC and I must never take it again.  My friend who was with me and is having the menopause said she had thought of taking it,. He said no definitely not, don't even think about it. So there you have it,dont really have much choice do we. I did wonder if as im so tiny id taken too high a dose, who knows, and tamoxifen is supposed to be best working drug, we have to trust the Drs I guess. June
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen v letrazole

Posts.Content: Hi, I only had a lumpdectomy Croxley so have no personal experience but can only tell you about a good friend of mine who had a mastectomy at 25 as her mum and aunt had BC and her her sister and her cousin all had the BR gene . so they all decided to have a full mastectomy. This was about 18 years ago and they all have had problems with the implants. and had to have them renewed, my friend had it done twice and was told to get her breasts right size  could be done again but at 42 shes decided against it. She says its only cosmetic, it doesent  look quite right, in fact I was staying round hers for New Year and when she put top on she said, does my boob look ok, in clothes looks fine but when undressed she says she can notice it,  Her husband has told her not to bother  and she says she wont, if she hadn't had mastectomy , she could have had cancer by now and as only cosmetic she just feels glad to be ok and though her sister and cousin have had ovaries taken as well as shes youngest she hasn't so she ,might have that  to contend with in next few years, Shes a very attractive women with a lovely figure but shes accepted a wonky boob is a small price to pay for preventing cancer,  June
Posts.Title: Need help with decision

Posts.Content: Hi, I only had a lumpdectomy Croxley so have no personal experience but can only tell you about a good friend of mine who had a mastectomy at 25 as her mum and aunt had BC and her her sister and her cousin all had the BR gene . so they all decided to have a full mastectomy. This was about 18 years ago and they all have had problems with the implants. and had to have them renewed, my friend had it done twice and was told to get her breasts right size  could be done again but at 42 shes decided against it. She says its only cosmetic, it doesent  look quite right, in fact I was staying round hers for New Year and when she put top on she said, does my boob look ok, in clothes looks fine but when undressed she says she can notice it,  Her husband has told her not to bother  and she says she wont, if she hadn't had mastectomy , she could have had cancer by now and as only cosmetic she just feels glad to be ok and though her sister and cousin have had ovaries taken as well as shes youngest she hasn't so she ,might have that  to contend with in next few years, Shes a very attractive women with a lovely figure but shes accepted a wonky boob is a small price to pay for preventing cancer,  June
Posts.Title: Need help with decision

Posts.Content: Hi, I had BC two years ago,like you im tiny 4 11 weighed 6 and half stone then not really enough now 7 stone the half stone honestly suits me better, I now have a 32 d bust, I only had a lumpedecomy  used to be 32 b but apart from didn't lose any weight or really gain much. Didn't have chemo as my oncologist said the benefit was minimal and as I was so tiny he felt might make me ill as would have to have massive dose to make even slightest difference, Had rads and on tamoxifen, probably why my bust size increased, I know many get weight gain with it, but although ive a few reasonably manageable side effects, weight gain isn't one of them. But I expect like me it sounds like you've always been tiny so sure you wont either.  June.
Posts.Title: What type of breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi, My BC wasn't genetic, as I no one in my family with it.  But a close friend of mine has the BCRA gene, Her mum and aunt both died of BC some years ago, and there were other cancer victims in the family. Hers was passed through the male line before it reached her mum and aunt. Her sister and cousin also had gene.  Hers I think was helped because before she died her mum donated tissue so the tests could be carried out more successfully.This was 18 years ago in the sort of infancy of it, then they had to fight to get the tests done.  Was very fortunate they did as they all tested positively for the gene, her sister in fact had a cancer already forming which the test found I was successfully removed and shes fine today.  All 3 of them had a double mascectomy and reconstruction. and all are well to this day.Her cousin and sister who are the oldest have had ovaries removed to, as yet my friend hasn't; Another close friend of mine lost many relatives to ovarian and breast cancer, years ago  her mum and one of her cousins had ovarian but survived, She had ovarian same time as I had breast but had the test and was told hers wasn't genetic, although she still feels some connection,. Shes ok now to has to have 3 monthly check ups but all ok so far.  The test from what they all said is quite straight forward.   June
Posts.Title: Genetics testing

Posts.Content: Im retired but honestly if I had still been at work,i did work in an  office, I would  have had no problems working after RT.i sit my friends dog ,most days for her and she came with me first day she was amazed I walzed out and said id be fine dog sitting and I was. I rarely felt tired, and my skin stayed pretty normal throughout,  I did cream it regularly though. I felt fortunate I didn't need chemo and RT was to be honest a doddle, it dosent hurt, you are not in for long and they make you feel really at ease, it seems long when you start but it soon goes.  if I had evening appointments friends took me as I don't drive but during day I got the bus from very  near my house straight to hospital, I do live in a city with a good direct service but never felt any after effects, and got bus back to my friends house to dog sit.Now a year later, ive no scars at all apart from a very faint one where the lump was removed.  and still a bit of numbness as l had all my nodes removed, Hope this helps. June
Posts.Title: How many people worked through RT? Is it doable ?

Posts.Content: Saw surgeon, didnt like him very brusque and as foreign found it hard to understand him, breast care nice was lovely but he didnt seem interested in me at all, glad my friends were with me.  Seems although only have cancerous lump removed but the lympth gland they checked seems to have some cells, will need others removed, ill need chemo to.That scares me it isnt what i expected, does it make it more risky i wont survive, i could live with the op and radio therapy but this is too much,but he says they need to make sure all cells killed,. Fixed op date for 9th Feb then later got call to say due to operational reasons date needs to be changed, The breast nurse was great but thank god my lovely friend was with me she took over the call and said she didnt think i would stand a longer wait living alone, as i do, and yes ive great friends but they cant be there all time, could they do something. So now have got another surgeon, good, on 29th Jan, Still worried though i said would having whole breast removed be better, id have both off if necessary but he said no,its not in breast anywhere else, but the lump is at top of breast not actually in it not that far from lympth glands so thats why its strayed  Has anyone else had this kind of lump,i feel ive taken a step back again.
Posts.Title: Saw Surgeon

Posts.Content: Yes was told i could have reconstruction  if necessary, but as ive reasonably small boobs, 32 c cup and im slim he didnt think possibly would be be necessary. Also im not a high risk of lympthodema sure thats wrong spelling, as im healthy in other ways and am not overweight, I think his attitude really didnt help, ive just been thinking lump and radio as even when i first saw my dr she examined my lympth glands and said def not swollen and thought ok, and i knew id lose one as a precaution. but depends what other glands say when examined i guess,. I will ring and talk to a mcmillian nurse i feel its much worse than i first thought and am finding it hard to get my head around it, just want the damm thing out of me.  as long as boobs look ok under clothes, fine, but id happily lose them if had to.
Posts.Title: Saw Surgeon

Posts.Content: Thanks Genny, i think to be honest trouble was the surgeon i was originally going to have to be honest made my skin crawl. i just found him repulsive ive got to be honest, even his voice irritated me and i and my friends found it hard to understand him as not English.so now ive different surgeon, i dont particularly want to meet him, just get it removed. I think it was fact id got my head around having cancerous lump and having it out, and radio therapy but just didnt think my lympth notes would have problem as they arent swollen i just worry that means less chance of getting over it.and it not coming back.Are you ever same person again, can you be, with it hanging over your head, like the sword of dammacleas.every time you have a check up it might come back. I dont think situation is helped by the fact i lost a dear friend in sept with jt,ok she had the gene,  and has had it twice before her mum had died of it, years ago,  her daughter also a friend is having problems getting checked for gene, and thats all i can think of she didnt survive,. she had breasts removed had chemo, but it didnt save her getting her out of my head is really difficult,however hard i try,.
Posts.Title: Saw Surgeon

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies would be good to know Caroline how you go,.  I feel a bit confused by it all, i had a bone scan backin summer as ive high risk of osteop as my mum had it badly, Because i took such a dislike to the surgeon and i really did find it hard to understand himi i didnt take it all in nor did my friends, who were with me,. Breast nurse explained it afterwards, seems its what they call a "mopping up" to just make sure nothing is lurking,. I want the operation to get the damm things out and does seem you can live without lympth glands, in arm,  as my friend said youve lots in other places in your body. i  just imaginedpicking up all sorts of infections.ive always had a great immune system thats another reason i cant take it in, and i still feel so healthy surely if my lympth glands were not right i wouldnt, So confused, these damm doctors should talk to people as human beings not machines, Ive never smoked, never eaten a macdonalds even, dont eat red meat, never been overweight, walk everywhere, come from a ,long living family my dad lived  to 98 ailed nothing till over 90, no cancer in my family, and my mum  had osteo and a bad menopause but not much else wrong, she lived to 82 but  if i can get cancer so can anyone.is there any point in all this do this and that, Im still finding it all hard to believe.
Posts.Title: Saw Surgeon

Posts.Content: Hi Sally.  Great news, its a wonderful feeling, isn't it,.  I have had 2 yearly mammograms since mine in 2015 and all well,.  I had an easier time than you thankfully no chemo but rads and on tamoxifen feel fine now. My oldest friend had ovarian cancer same time as I had breast, shes a Sally to. shes fine now to, she has to have 3 month checks but her prognosis is good. We meet every month for a meal and a bottle wine, and we toast our good fortune.lol Its good to hear positive stories it gives hope to those who are going through the diagnosis and treatments, because then you do fear the worst,  Good luck to you and hope all goes well. June
Posts.Title: It's been a year and I'm in the clear!

Posts.Content: Hi, I didn't really feel elated till after I saw the oncologist and he told me I didn't need chemo. Before then I was sure I wasn't going to have it anyway, in spite of my close friends telling me I should, One in particular, was really insistant I did,  One day she burst into tears and told me she wanted me to have it cause she didn't want me to die, she cared so much about me, and so did her dog, which I often care for when shes at work. She was always ringing me checking on me, sometimes it got a bit much, but I realised she cared and I knew if I needed her she only lives bout mile away, I only had to ring and shed be round.She even worked a sat so she could come to hospital with me during week.  As I don't have much family this was a comfort..  I only told her and a few other close friends until I was sure of situation, as I didn't want to many people asking me how I was. Sometimes you just don't need that, you just want to get through it and go back to normal.  But people do care, I guess its nice they care enough to be concerned, but I agree sometimes you feel you just don't need the "how are you" and I got a lot of "I cant believe you've had cancer" you look so well.  June
Posts.Title: Struggling today

Posts.Content: Hi, What a silly thoughtless woman.  I spose as I didn't have chemo no one outside my group of close friends,doctors  and neighbours knew I had cancer, and I didn't tell them. Why would I, I still don't say much about it if meet anyone new , maybe occasionally in passing, that's it,  With friends was fine as a close friend of mine has the BCRA gene as does her sister and cousin who all had mastectomies to remove breasts when young, her sister actually had BC,had long chat with her when diagnosed,helped a lot, another friends mum did die of it but were complications and she certainly never said such stuff to me,   knew her mum too. And my oldest friend from school was diagnosed with ovarian cancer same time as I with breast so we helped each other through it,now we rarely speak of it,Another friend used to get really upset and though I HAD to have chemo, and got  rather annoyed when I said I wouldn't, but as didn't need it, she accepted it, I knew was because she cared though, After I was through it I told others I kn ew but didn't go on about it and to be honest no one ever said wrong thing to me, My friend who had the ovarian though ran into someone else we at school with, now a rather obese lady and she said to my friend "o never thought youd get that you being slim and going to gym, look at me I haven't got it," id have said you don't know whats going on inside though, my friend bless her is just too nice,! Hope you continue to do well. June
Posts.Title: Just need a rant

Posts.Content: Hi Just a quick reply to add to others,  I had BC two years ago Stage 2/3 But as only first node affected and clear margins no chemo just rads and on tamoxifen.  However my oldest friend was diagnosed with ovarian cancer at same time, stage 4 had 5 hour op leisons removed from her bowel and lungs.  However 2 years later, she didn't even have chemo as her kind of  cancer doesent react well to it, she is well and enjoying life. Yes she has 3 monthly check ups but all been well so far and her prognosis is good.. shes on hormonal drugs   She looks well in fact just like her old self, So as other ladies say Stage 4 isn't the end, many like my friend are back living their lives.  June
Posts.Title: Scared, I think my breast cancer has gone to my liver....

Posts.Content: Hi, To be honest my BCC nurse, though seemed pleasant initially was basically a waste of time, when I was first given the results, I had two friends with me at time, I can remember her saying o well though on own,im single, no kids, you seem to have a good support network, Then when ,my friend drove me home my mobile went and this nurse was telling me the surgeon, who to be honest I didn't like at all, no empathy, wanted to put my operation off for nearly 2 weeks, I lost it on phone, my friend took over and told her a few home truths, and managed to get the operation sooner with another surgeon, a much more empathetic one.  She never handed me over to his nurse and I can hardly remember her at all, Never saw original nurse again and got little support from the successor, I think I only saw her when I saw the surgeon, I didn't even know her name.,  I cant fault my treatment in any other way, but the BCC nurses were a waste of time.  I felt glad I did have friends support cause I can imagine how it would be if someone doesent have partner,kids,etc. and was on their own with that kind of treatment.  June,
Posts.Title: More unnecessary tears...

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, I had breast cancer 3 yrs ago Been on tamoxifen ever since.I had few side effects initially so asked my GP if i could change to 2 10 mg tablets.I take one in morning one in evening and most side effects apart from flush here and there gone.So glad i did it as im very petite and slim i wondered maybe if 20mg at once too much.But whatever i certainly feel happier spreading the dose.Give it a go. Hope rads go well,i had no problems at all,used organic aloe vera cream,no scaring and little soreness. 3 mammograms on i feel fine. June
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Hi, I had similar to you stage 2 stage 3 cause aggressive but caught very early, first node suspect, so I told them a wanted full clearance with my lumpdectomy,  Reason for this was an old colleague of mine had BC some years ago and did not have her nodes taken,and it came back so I always said if I had it id have full clearance.  My other nodes were clear and so were margains, so could have left them but to be honest I felt better knowing what I kn ew they had gone.  Had rads and take tamoxifen. no chemo was told didn't need it. I did exercise as was told still do, but 2 years later, all seems well, no lymphedema. i do carry shopping etc, know you not spose to carry anything heavy but livin g on own you don't have lot of choice. My BC nurse told me she felt as a very slightly built women i had little risk of it anyway. yes it is a risk but then it made me feel happier having them removed and as said minimal side effects, if i lift my arm up, small dent there, but i still wear sleeveless tops and it isn't noticeable,. June
Posts.Title: Terrified at the thought of axillary clearance

Posts.Content: Hi, I wasn't given much info re this from Drs etc,but I have a friend who has the BR gene, she had her breasts removed when in 20s to prevent it, shes 42 now, her sister had hers removed round about same time and they found BC already. She told me not to use anti perspirant with parabens in so I haven't since I was diagnosed last year,  I use Ganier mineral paraben free, and in my bath either Santex or   any other without parabens , there are a few, But honestly with make up and hair products I still use what I did  before.  Around my breasts I only cream with Aloe vera organic creams though, and for hair dye I still use Nice and easy semi permanent with no ammonia which ive always used, I can get away with this as though in 60s my hair isn't totally grey and I think id rather use this more frequently anyway that use stronger dyes, My cancer was oestrogen based, due to I was told my long term use of \HRT as I had an early menopause but I feel as im obviously not taking that any more, im on tamoxifen is there is point in constantly worrying about what Im using in the cosmetic line apart from avoiding stuff that you use on breasts or under arms with parabens .  That seems best route to take, for me, it can become too much avoiding this and that I feel, where do you stop?. June
Posts.Title: Parabens, etc

Posts.Content: Hi, I had lumpdectomy, no chemo and rads. saw oncologist or some sort doctor year after, then had mammogram, ok so next year just had mammogram. ok again,  Am due to see Dr next year so guess at my hospital its every 2 years. you see a Dr.  I did have problem with my tamoxifen. so went to my GP though and she supplied prescription for 2 10 mg tablets , which suits me much better, didn't see point on bothering hospital.,as im fine in every other way. Guess its like others say you only have to see Drs every year if high risk, quite comforting really. June
Posts.Title: 2 yrs post-treatment, should I still be seeing Oncologist?

Posts.Content: Hi, I know how you feel, I had BC two years ago it was aggressive but found early, so was lumpectomy node removal, no chemo, just rads now on tamoxifen all but first node were clear, and clear margins.I feel lucky to,.when I hear of others and think got BC isn't the worst,. MY BC nurse told me that when I was diagnosed, she said now you will think that ridiculous, but now I know she was right, its one of best cancers to treat and one of easiest.  E ven if you survive it, the after effects can not be good for all, I was talking today with my hairdresser about her mum in law had BC about same time as I, but she had to have chemo which affected her badly, her heart for one, they seem to have sorted that but her bowel was affected, had operation on that, has to wear colostomy bag, till its reversed which hasn't been done yet. and now she has kidney problems, I know this is a worse than usual for chemo paitents but it does make you grateful for being here with no lasting effects and last mammogram few weeks ago was fine. Always having been such a healthy person I feel so grateful im back to how I was,  In fact I never actually felt ill at any time.  Hope you remain well. June
Posts.Title: Feeling sad but lucky!
